Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Associate Editor, Resource and Energy Economics
Editorial Board, International Review of Environmental and Resource Economics
Editorial Board, Review of Environmental Economics and Policy

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Presentations are too numerous to mention. I am a regular participant in the scientific conferences organized by EAERE, AERE, NBER, ASSA, etc.
Organizing Committee, AERE Summer Workshop in Banff AB

Keynote Lecture at the Italian Association of Environmental and Resource Economists (IAERE) annual meeting, Padova, February 20–21, 2015. “Developing guidance for addressing carbon leakage through border carbon adjustments.”
Keynote Lecture at the International Energy Workshop, Abu Dhabi. “The Road after Paris: the Role of Technology Policies in Supporting Future Commitments”

Environment and Climate Change Canada Special Lecture at Canadian Economic Association Meetings, Ottawa. “Overlapping Policies for Reducing GHGs: How do they interact, when are they useful, and when are they counterproductive?”

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Benjamin Franklin Scholar, University of Pennsylvania
Deutscher Akademischer Austausch Dienst (German Academic Exchange Service) scholarship, Universität Regensburg, Germany
Rackham Pre-Doctoral Fellowship, University of Michigan
Joseph L. Fisher Dissertation Award, Resources for the Future
Fellow, CESifo Research Network (Münchener Gesellschaft zur Förderung der Wirtschaftswissenschaft), Energy and Climate Economics Area
Member of Environment Canada’s Environmental Economics and Policy Research Network

Marie Skłodowska–Curie International Incoming Fellowship, 7th European Community Framework Program (International EU), EC Grant Agreement PIIF-GA-2013-623783 “STRATECHPOL—Strategic Clean Technology Policies for Climate Change,” 2014–2016 (EUR 242K). Principal investigator.

AquaFish Prize for Best Aquaculture Economics Paper, International Institute of Fisheries Economics & Trade, for Fischer C, Guttormsen A, Smith M (2016). Disease Risk and Market Structure in Salmon Aquaculture. WATER ECONOMICS AND POLICY, vol. 2, doi: 10.1142/S2382624X16500156

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Climate Policy Research (CLIPORE) Program, one of the longest international research programs on climate policies ever conducted, funded by the Swedish Mistra Foundation, focused on future international policies in the area of climate change. Investigator in research consortium with partners including Center for International Climate and Environmental Research Oslo - CICERO; Gothenburg University, Department of Economics; IVL Swedish Environmental Research Institute; Linköping University; Resources for the Future - RFF; Stockholm Environmental Institute - SEI; The Energy and Resources Institute - TERI, India; Uppsala University, Department of Government; and Stockholm University, Dept. of Sociology. http://www.mistra.org/en/mistra/research /completed-research/clipore---mistras-cl imate-policy-research-programme.html

Environment and Trade in a World of Interdependence (ENTWINED) Program, funded by the Swedish Mistra Foundation. Phase I 2007–9 (SEK 19M). Phase II 2010–2013 (SEK 34M). Investigator in international research consortium with partners at Columbia University, NY; Gothenburg University; Research Institute of Industrial Economics - IFN; International Institute for Sustainable Development - IISD; IVL; Queens University, Canada; RFF; and Statistics Norway. http://www.entwined.se/
Research Council of Norway, Fremtidens rene energisystem (RENERGI). Emission trading in Europe: The importance of allocation rules. Investigator with partners at Statistics Norway.

Instrument Design for Global Climate Mitigation (INDIGO) Program, funded by the Swedish Mistra Foundation (Swedish Foundation for Strategic Environmental Research), SEK 24.5M. Investigator in international consortium with Gothenburg University, IVL, and RFF. http://indigo.ivl.se/

Strengthening Efficiency and Competitiveness in the European Knowledge Economies (SEEK) Grant: Competitiveness impacts in the world with uneven carbon constraints—Examining the implications of the EU Emissions Trading Scheme on energy intensive industries. Investigator in joint program with Center for European Economic Research (ZEW), Mannheim.
Policy Advisory Board, “Economic iNsTRuments to Achieve Climate Targets in Europe” (ENTRACTE) Project, funded under the EU’s 7th Framework Programme.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Instructor, Natural Resource and Environmental Economics, Johns Hopkins University, Washington DC USA

Center for Advanced Study at the Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters, Fellowship with the group Environmental Economics: Policy Instruments, Technology Development, and International Cooperation.
Visiting Professor (10% appointment), University of Gothenburg, Sweden
UCE3 Senior Fellow, Visiting Scholar in Bren School of Environmental Science and Management, UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA—SANTA BARBARA
Dahrendorf Visiting Fellow, London School of Economics, London UK
Marie Skłodowska–Curie Fellow and Senior Researcher FONDAZIONE ENI ENRICO MATTEI (FEEM), Venice, Italy

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Environmental Protection Agency Grant CX825715: Multinational Taxation and International Emissions Permit Trading. Principal Investigator.
EPA/STAR Grant R828628–01–0: Efficiency and Distributional Consequences of the Allocation of Tradable Emission Allowances. Principal Investigator.
Asian Development Bank, Technical Assistant Grant, Metro Manila Air Quality Improvement Loan. Co-Principal Investigator with A. Krupnick and R. Morgenstern.
EPA Grant 829256–01–1: Policies for Encouraging Carbon–Reducing Technologies. Principal Investigator.
EPA/STAR Grant RD83099101: Rate-based Allocation Mechanisms for Market-based Environmental Policies: Interactions with Pre-Existing Taxes and Uncertainty, Principal Investigator.
World Bank Grant: Feasibility of Corporate Codes of Environmental Conduct, 2004. Principal Investigator.
USDA #43–3AEM–4–80089: Spatial Management of Invasive Alien Species, 2004–07 ($193K) Principal Investigator, with J. Sanchirico and H.J. Albers.
EPA RD–83285101: A Conceptual and Empirical Framework for Analyzing Information Disclosure Programs, 2006–8 ($327K), Co-investigator with I. Parry, R. Newell and J. Siikamaki.

US EPA / Science to Achieve Results (STAR) Grant: Differentiating Passenger Vehicles by Fuel Economy: Strategic Incentives and the Cost–Effectiveness of Tradable CAFE Standards, 2008–9 ($80K). Principal investigator.

US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) GRANT (#83413401): Market Impacts and Distributional Consequences of Pollution Control Mechanisms. 10/2009–12/2013. ($286K) Principal investigator, with R. Newell and S. Anderson.

Marie Skłodowska–Curie International Incoming Fellowship, 7th European Community Framework Program (International EU), EC Grant Agreement PIIF-GA-2013-623783 “STRATECHPOL—Strategic Clean Technology Policies for Climate Change,” 2014–2016 (EUR 242K). Principal investigator.
